Reviews.Title: “Good four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: emellau
Reviews.Content: Its very comfortable hotel. Hotel Ä±s Ä±n great locatÄ±on and alsÄ±o very close to grand bazaar. Hotel stuff are very kÄ±nd and also have great restaurant wÄ±th panorama vÄ±ew.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Istanbul, Good choice I made”
Reviews.Author: Haithem K
Reviews.Content: I want to show my appreciations to the manager Soneir. He was very helpful and made my shorttrip memorable. I planned my trip one day before departure, didnt know where to go, a friend suggested I stay in Oran, immediatly sent an email for enquiery/reservation, got a prompt response and that was it. The Hotel was good , nearest to the touristic landmarks, Grand Bazar, Sofia, Blue Mosque, less than 5 mins Tramway station. Deinitrely i will go back to Istanbul, and for sure to Oran.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Recent stay in Oran Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claire G
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, central location and very good price - fab view from resturant!

Reviews.Title: “samsoun”
Reviews.Author: samia d
Reviews.Content: oran hotel is a nice hotel , the rooms were clean and quiet , the staf were very helpful and kind especially the receptionist Huseyn. this hotel is near to the most important touristic site: grand bazar ..., the blue mosque.. I will comeback inchallah ,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: nikopool
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was amazing - it was one of the best hotels we have stayed in in Europe - certainly at the price we paid! Hotel staff were extremely friendly, and although we were too early to check-in, we were welcomed to use the facilities while we waited. Hotel was modern and clean. Restaurant had lovely view and great food. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I love the hotel and realy would like to return back”
Reviews.Author: TomBasrah
Reviews.Content: I would like to send my great appriciations for Oran Hotel Staff and especailly for Mr. Soner, the General Manager and the other staff for their hard work to facilitate the acomodation for the people. I realy enjoy staying there and hope Inshallah, I will return back soon to the same hotel. Thanks a lot for your efforts. Thamer

Reviews.Title: “Very good location , good staff”
Reviews.Author: AyÅŸegÃ¼l K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Oran Hotel for my business. Very good location in Laleli, very close to Sultanahmet and historical places. Good staff, clean room thanks for all I'll back again. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Luvtotravel2000
Reviews.Content: At the recommendation of a college friend who travels quite frequently to Istanbul, I stayed at the Oran Hotel in December 2000. The Staff was very welcoming and most importantly, the hotel was cleaned. I had access to their sauna with complementary messages; which was a plus. I saw the gym but was too lazy to use it. The restaurant and bar were exceptional. Overall, I enjoyed my stay. In August 2010, I stayed again at the Hotel. This time, the whole hotel had just been renovated. The Staff was still welcoming and the whole experience a success again. I am going this year and plan to stay there again. I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DekuSutta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Oran Hotel while visiting friends, me and my family enjoyed the facilities very much - it was a great match for the Wonderful City of Istanbul. Beautiful Rooms and over the top service, not too expensive, them again I would always like to pay less for anything, but a stay like this was truly worth it. I would recommend this Hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up !”
Reviews.Author: BarisSener
Reviews.Content: Oran Hotel was recommended by a family friend to us. We were thrilled with the service they provided. I have taken my spouse to Istanbul before, and this was the first time for our kids to experience this beautiful city. Thank you very much to all Oran Hotel crew made our visit cozy, flawless and effortless with their top-notch service. Very close to Taksim and must-see historical venues, transportation is easy and hassle-free, food was great and authentic. I would highly recommend this place for accommodation to anyone. Two thumbs up and thank you very much again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gat0r_07
Reviews.Content: I live in Destin,Florida and my friends and I decided to travel to Turkey last fall. We were staying at Oran Otel and we were very impressed with their service. We spent a week in Istanbul and we had a great time and this was mostly due to the Oran Otel's friendly staff and we especially loved their restaurant Panorama. Every morning we had breakfast at Panaroma and we couldnt wait to be there the next morning. I believe the hotel was renovated recently so the rooms were pretty clean and comfortable. The location was important for me because i dont like dealing with traffic and this hotel is close to what they call the old Istanbul so you could go to the places you have to see in a short period of time. If I were you and if I was going to Istanbul, I would choose this hotel. I would love to go back there again. Thank you...

Reviews.Title: “Great quality-price performance”
Reviews.Author: ahurdogan
Reviews.Content: I visit Istanbul regularly for business mostly , this time I found a great hotel. I am very positive about the location , price and quality of rooms , service and everything. I definitely advise to visit this city and if you can arrange you should book a room from Oran Hotel (close to airport , old city and other popular places in town)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing times...”
Reviews.Author: muzzy81
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Oran Hotel for our honeymoon. My wife and I liked this Hotel very much. The stuff was very polite and friendly. The rooms were clean and fresh. I specially loved our room and the view. Hotel's restaurant was very good. We loved the food at Panorama Restaurant. Also, the Hotel location was great. Most of the important places are within walking distance. My wife and I really recommend this hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “AFFORDABLE QUALITY IN THE HEART OF THE CITY...”
Reviews.Author: OzBalacowski
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul for a business trip for a short 3 days, and was surprisingly delighted to stay at Oran Hotel. I was kind a skeptical once I booked this hotel since I was paying $114 per night whereas I have paid around $240 per night at the other hotels in my previous two trips to Istanbul. I got a GREAT VALUE by staying at this nicely renovated hotel. Friendly people, nice & clean rooms. Check the view of the old city at the rooftop. They also gave me a complimentary pick-up/drop-off at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and relax”
Reviews.Author: FIRSTMINUTETRAVEL
Reviews.Content: i and my collegues were stayed at Oran Hotel for 3 days and was very satisfied with service. very clean and nice looking rooms and friendly staff ,its located in centre of istanbul ,close to many touristic places.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: infotek
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Clean and comfortable room. The Panorama Restaurant has an amazing view. Nice Breakfast. Central Istanbul but the Old city is within walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: heatherjohnston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Oran Otel for our 10 year wedding anniversary and I fell in love with it. Very nice location.Very clean. Wonderful, stylish room and friendly, helpful staff...

Reviews.Title: “uninviting dark clean room BUT....”
Reviews.Author: fremel
Reviews.Content: very unfriendly staff, at the reception and restaurant. The room was dark, very uninviting, but clean and the location very good. The mattress was so hard that my hips were hurting. I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “scumbled!”
Reviews.Author: novelty_mug
Reviews.Content: awful hotel; and cant spell scramble egg (aparently its spelt scumbled egg?)

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ayka_04
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my family.it was my first trip and i liked hotel very much.i am glad that i choose this hotel.the rooms are very clean.beds and sheets very comfortable.i felt my self here like at home.i advise you to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Life's too short to stay here overnight”
Reviews.Author: SR1234
Reviews.Content: We were on a busy tour, and unfortunately this was our first hotel for 3 nights. Whilst the location was good, and very central (less than 1km from the main sites), that's about all that was good. Location - opposite a disco. Rooms at the back were quiet, but those facing the road were very noisy. Room Facilities - adequate, although the step into/out of the shower cubicle was so high that anyone under five foot tall is risking life and limb getting out! (although to be fair, this was common in some of the other hotels we stayed at). Empty minibar. Room safe did not work. Staffing - disinterested. Food- although the panoramic views from the restaurant were great, the food wasn't up to scratch for a four star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...within walking distance to everything in the Old Town.”
Reviews.Author: Bumihills
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Oran is its location. It is a short walk away to the tram stop but best of all, it is a walkable distance for most folks (I'm in my 60s) to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, Topkapi and the Galata Bridge...in one day if you aren't a heavy shopper. The rooms are small but comfortable. Best to have a room off the street and with windows facing the outside (there are a few with windows over the lobby area....and these can get noisy). Breakfast buffet was good by standards of other Turkish hotels. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful though not super fluent in English. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others who want feel a location is more important than luxury.

Reviews.Title: “A useful base”
Reviews.Author: Archaeologist
Reviews.Content: I stayed here about the same time as the reviewer who complained the hotel was too hot. In fact the weather in Istanbul was unseasonally cold and we were glad of the heating when coming back from a long day of sightseeing. The rooms looking onto the street were noisy; the others looked into the central well and got the noise of the kitchen extractor unit. The hotel is dark with lots of brown wood but our room was adequate and clean. The staff spoke little English but were as helpful as possible. The restaurant on the top floor had a wonderful view over the city but does not open every evening. One night we ate downstairs and found a limited menu but managed to put away very succulent lamb chops and the prices were reasonable. Over our stay we stayed in 6 hotels and the Oran's beer was the cheapest by quite a long way. Breakfast was an adequate buffet though a limited choice of bread and watery orange juice. This is a city centre hotel, in a pleasant area where I never felt ill at ease; we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “adequate hotel, hard to regulate temperature”
Reviews.Author: josieAlabama
Reviews.Content: Spent time here in March with Gate 1 travel; the rooms are fairly small, the beds are comfy and the bathroom was more than adequate. The problem was that the central heat was on and you can not turn it off. We did open our windows that make the temperature tolerable. These Turks seem cold natured; the hotels could save themselves money on letting patrons turn off the heat. The breakfast was adequate and the location of the hotel is really good; just three blocks from the tram which will take you to most places you will want to see. Ask for a room that does not face the street....it seems to be noiser at night than in the day time, and if you want to open your windows....well, you get the picture. I do highly recommend Gate 1 Tour to Turkey; it was inexpensive, comprehensive and lots of fun. We had a great guide, Neco, who was a literal encyclopedia of Turkish history. Turkey is a wonderful country with really nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location BUT”
Reviews.Author: femalenomad68
Reviews.Content: The location of Oran Hotel near the Covered Bazaar is handy. The hotel caters to tour groups and has a nice breakfast buffet. However, the front desk speaks little English and tends to be rude. One person in our party received the following response, "Do I look like a travel agent?" The most serious problem for anyone older is the bathtubs. The edge of the bathtub is MILES from the floor. Getting out of the tub was an adventure I didn't need. In short, persons with the slightest mobility problems should avoid this hotel. Lila Sullivan Salem, Va, USA

Reviews.Title: “A decent well-located value hotel”
Reviews.Author: TMGArlington_VA
Reviews.Content: Agree with the other reviews in the main, with a few differences and additions: Some of the complaints in the other reviews seem directed at European hotels in general. The Oran didn't seem especially different from our other hotel stays abroad. We found the front desk staff to be very helpful in several requests. There is a small but professional Turkish bath in the hotel that gives a discount to guests; they do a nice job. We had 2 different rooms, at the beginning and end of the trip; both were relatively large and comfortable. The first one was noisy, mainly due to a Friday night disco nearby. The second was blessedly quiet. There are a lot of tour groups using the hotel, but that didn't create any real problems. The location is quite good, for walking or taking the tram to the key sites. There are small grocery stores and modest restaurants in the neighborhood. The food at the Oran (especially main courses) was mediocre, although they had great yogurt. Try the charming restaurant (Sehzade Mehmed Sofrast) in the former medressa at the nearby mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Tenormary
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a Gate 1 tour. The Oban is well located for touring Istanbul ... a few blocks from the tram line, and within walking distance of interesting mosques. The front rooms are noisy ... they face on a very busy wholesale street. The desk staff is not fluent in English, but make an attempt. We stayed there at the beginning of the trip and had an adequate room with twin beds and a decent bath with shower. The end of the trip stay, which was for three nights, was in a very small front room with twin beds in which we could hardly turn around. I do not understand why European hotels do not have any clothing storage space, particularly when booking stays of more than one night. The Oban had NO drawers into which one could unpack. And only one luggage rack, which also seems to be the norm ... even in a twin bedded room. Do they assume that all travelers will share one suitcase and will never want to get to the clothing packed on the bottom? The area around the hotel is a wholesale district which caters to Russians. It is culturally interesting, but there are no restaurants to speak of unless one walks over to the viaduct region. It was clean however. A plus certainly.

HotelInfo.Name: Oran Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Harikzedeler Sok. 36-42 Laleli, Istanbul 34470, Turkey
